meanings.definition: Of or relating to the iris of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The iridic color of her eyes sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the iridic patterns in the patient's eyes.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her iridic eyes could see through walls.
meanings.sent4: The iridic glow in her eyes revealed her excitement.
meanings.sent5: The iridic hue of her eyes was mesmerizing.

meanings.sent1: The jewelry was made of an iridic metal that shone brightly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the iridic properties of the rare metal.
meanings.sent3: He claimed his iridic necklace was from outer space.
meanings.sent4: The iridic shine of the metal caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The iridic element added a unique touch to the jewelry.

meanings.sent1: The rock had an iridic sheen that made it stand out.
meanings.sent2: The artist used paint with an iridic quality for the masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The cake decorator added an iridic touch to the frosting.
meanings.sent4: The iridic glimmer of the gemstone was captivating.
meanings.sent5: The iridic streaks in the painting added depth to the artwork.
